title: Impact Clean Power Technology builds plant in Poland
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Poland, but the exact location has not been disclosed by Impact Clean Power Technology (ICPT).

Capacity:
- The GigafactoryX will initially produce 2 GWh of batteries per year starting from 2024, and it aims to reach a capacity of 5 GWh in the final stage.

Investment amounts:
- The specific capital invested in the project has not been mentioned. However, ICPT has contracted Teamtechnik to build an automated assembly line for the production of batteries for buses, trams, and trains at its production facility in Poland.

Project progress:
- The construction of the GigafactoryX has begun, and ICPT has contracted Teamtechnik to build an automated assembly line for battery production. Assembly work is scheduled to begin in July 2023.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as ICPT is constructing the GigafactoryX from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover several stages of the battery manufacturing value chain, including cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly. Additionally, the production lines will be highly automated and powered by a photovoltaic system.

Note: The project aims to use renewable energy, second-life battery systems, and recycled raw materials for production, and it plans to base production on short supply chains from European companies.

title: Plans for battery gigafactory in Poland unveiled
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project, named GigafactoryX, is located in the city of Pruszków, Poland, near Warsaw.

Capacity:
- The production capacity is planned to increase to 1.2 GWh in 2024 and more than 4 GWh in 2027.

Investment amounts:
- The specific investment amounts and subsidies are not provided in the given information.

Project progress:
- The project is in the phase of unveiling plans and is scheduled to begin assembly work in July 2023, with the commissioning of the first automated production line scheduled for January 2024.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as it is being constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly for battery systems for electric buses and energy storage.

Note: The specific investment amounts and subsidies are not provided in the given information.

title: GigafactoryX: Advanced 5MWh EV battery manufacturing facility to be built in Poland
notes:
Location:
- The GigafactoryX battery facility is located in Poland.

Capacity:
- The planned production capacity of the GigafactoryX is 5GWh per year.

Investment amounts:
- The investment in the new facility will provide five times more annual production capacity than the company’s current 1MWh.
- The company has not disclosed the specific amount of capital invested in the project, but it has been mentioned that the facility will involve the employment of approximately 200 new employees.

Project progress:
- The construction of GigafactoryX has been announced, with the start of production planned for 2024.

Project type:
- The GigafactoryX is a new build facility.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the production of lithium-ion cells in LTO, LFP, and NMC technologies, with highly automated production lines to improve efficiency and reduce carbon dioxide emissions.

Note: The information provided does not specify the receipt of any subsidies for the project.

title: FAMUR Group investing in energy storage and electro-mobility. Acquires IMPACT CLEAN POWER TECHNOLOGY
notes:
Location:
- Poland

Capacity:
- N/A

Investment amounts:
- FAMUR Group has acquired a majority stake in Impact Clean Power Technology for the price of 59.12 million EUR. The purchase of assets was financed with funds from the issue of FAMUR Green Bonds, acquired in 2021 for 400 million PLN.

Project progress:
- FAMUR Group's acquisition of Impact Clean Power Technology marks a strategic move to diversify its business activities into green transformation, following last year's investment in the photovoltaic sector. The acquisition is in line with FAMUR Group's strategy to transform into a holding investing in green transformation, aiming to achieve 70% income not related to coal power by 2024. The partnership with Impact Clean Power Technology is intended to develop and scale the business in the growing market of battery and energy storage systems.

Project type:
- Acquisition of Impact Clean Power Technology, a leading manufacturer of battery systems in Poland.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the production and integration of advanced systems for the storage of energy in lithium-ion cells, with plans to develop systems utilizing hydrogen fuel cells. The company delivers large-scale energy storage facilities for the Renewable Energy Source (RES) sector and industrial power systems, serving clients in transportation, manufacturing, energy production, railways, and telecommunications sectors.
